thread.title: Religion in our community: Upcoming events
thread.title_full: Religion in our community: Upcoming events

author: Guest
title: Religion in our community: Upcoming events
text:
TODAY
Good Friday Worship Night: 6:30-8 p.m., Journey Church, 1801 S. Fayetteville St., Asheboro. Free.
journeyasheboro.com.
SUNDAY
The Resurrection: 10 a.m., Wells Memorial Church of God in Christ, 1001 E. Washington St., Greensboro. Free. Biblical reenactment by the Wells Memorial Fine Arts Ministry. 336-601-0228.
Easter Sunrise Service: 7 a.m., High Point University, Kester International Promenade in front of the Charles E. Hayworth Chapel. Student leaders in the chapel community will lead worship, and the Rev. Preston Davis, minister of the university, will provide a sermon centered on the Easter story. Communion will also be shared with those in attendance. Also, watch online at
www.highpoint.edu/live-stream.
TUESDAY, APRIL 2
People are also reading…
Free Health Check-ups: 3-6 p.m., United House of Grace and Mercy, 1309 Leonard Ave., High Point. Head and neck cancer screening, blood pressure screening, blood sugar screening, medication review. Bring medications to talk with a pharmacist. Learn about senior medication care and get connected with the Community Clinic. No registration necessary. 336-701-5810.
SATURDAY, APRIL 6
Chicken Pie Supper: 5-8 p.m., Hines Chapel Church, 4476 Hines Chapel Road, McLeansville. Dine in or take out. Adults, $10; Children, 8 and younger, $6. Chicken pie, green beans, coleslaw, roll, dessert, tea. Proceeds go toward church projects. 336-621-1385.
Clothing and Household Goods Giveaway: 10 a.m.-2 p.m., Wells Memorial Church of God in Christ, 1001 E. Washington St., Greensboro. Adult and children’s free clothing and free household goods giveaway.
SATURDAY, APRIL 13
Hot Dog Sale for Missions: 11 a.m.-2 p.m., Moriah United Methodist Church, 3611 Liberty Road, Greensboro. Dine in or take outs available.
www.moriahumc.org.
Hot Dog and Fresh Apple Pie Sale: 10 a.m.-1 p.m., Newlyn Street United Methodist Church, 212 E. Newlyn St., Greensboro. Dine in or take out. Hot dogs, $2; pies, $3; soft drinks, $1. Benefits church missions. For pie pre-orders, call 336-897-5978 and leave a message with your name, phone number and the amount of pies you would like.
“Be Set Free,” Lecture by Nicole Virgil: noon, First Church of Christ, Scientist, 105 Arden Place, Greensboro. Virgil is a Christian Science practitioner and member of the Christian Science Board of Lectureship.
www.christiansciencegreensboro.org.
SATURDAY, APRIL 20
Groometown Gospel Singing: 6:30 p.m., Groometown Baptist Church, 4202 Groometown Road, Greensboro. With Montgomery Trio. Refreshments at nominal charge served at intermission, benefits missions. Piano music with Pat Wade starts at 6:15 p.m. 336-460-6037.
SATURDAY, APRIL 27
Rainbow Tea and Fashion Show: noon-2 p.m., Holmes Grove United Methodist Church, 1100 Alamance Church Road, Greensboro. Catered lunch. Raffle for gift baskets. United Women in Faith, formerly United Methodist Women, is presenting this event. Register by April 19. Tickets are $24, $10 for children under age 10.
tinyurl.com/2karwa4e.
